tutorial.settings.title: Guide - Settings
tutorial.settings.text1: Various settings can be changed in the menu item Settings. The settings are automatically stored in the browser cache, LocalStorage, as user settings and are taken into account on your next visit.
tutorial.settings.text2: The various categories can be fold/unfold by clicking on the category.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.data.text1: The currently selected data source is listed under Data. The button Change opens a dialog box in which the current data source can be reset/changed.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.data.text2: In the load options you can select how the data of the respective data set should be loaded. There are four options available:
tutorial.settings.subtitle.data.item1: Offline first: If the data is available in the browser cache, the data is loaded via the cache and there is no online access. If the data in not available, the data is automatically loaded online via the web service and saved in the cache.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.data.item2: Online first: The data is always reloaded via the web service, so it is always up-to-data. The data from the cache is only used if there is no connection to the web service.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.data.item3: Offline: The data is only loaded from the cache. If the data is not available, nothing is loaded.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.data.item4: Online: The data is always reloaded online and not stored in the cache.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.searchoptions: If, in addition to the results, the objects for which the descriptor was not set, should also be listed, the tolerances can be activated. Note: Search queries may slow down.

In the standard query, with the grouping AND between the descriptors, the selection list of the descriptors and the states is restricted to the results that are still possible. Note: This is not possible in the Extended Search, since a search is only started via the Search button.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.sorting.text1: The sorting of the descriptors and states can be set differently. There are three options for sorting the descriptors, the first two for the states:
tutorial.settings.subtitle.sorting.item1: Default - DB: The sorting is based on the order of the descriptors in the database.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.sorting.item3: Significance: Sorting is by the Significance column in the dataset.
tutorial.settings.subtitle.sorting.text2: Sorting can be in ascending or descending order.
tutorial.query.title: Guide - Query
tutorial.query.text1: There are three different query types. The standard query, the extended query and the search for the name of the objects/descriptions/items.
tutorial.query.standard.title: Standard query
tutorial.query.standard.text1: By clicking in the descriptor selection field, a scrollable list of all descriptors opens. The selection field can be restricted by entering text. In the example, only descriptors containing the string sub are listed.
tutorial.query.standard.text2: If you want do disable keyboard input to save space, you can click on the keyboard icon to the right of the field.
tutorial.query.standard.text3: By clicking on Grouping, the way in which descriptors and states are linked can be changed. The default is AND between different descriptors and OR between states within a descriptor. If different combinations are to be used within a search query, the extended search can be used.
tutorial.query.standard.text4: After selecting a descriptor, a dialog box appears. A distinction is made here according to the type of descriptors.
tutorial.query.standard.categorical.text: A selection of all possible states that can be selected appears in the dialog window. Multiple selections are allowed and will be linked according to the setting for States under Grouping.

Clicking outside the list collapses the list and the selection can be confirmed with OK. A search will start immediately. The selected descriptor and states are listed in a tree structure. The number of items/objects that meet all the selected criteria appears next to the Results tab or button. In the example this is 1001.
tutorial.query.standard.quantitative.tex: For quantitative descriptors, a comparison operator is selected and one or two values are specified.

The selection is confirmed with OK and the search starts immediately. The selected descriptor and states are listed in a tree structure. The number of items/objects that meet all the selected criteria appears next to Results tab or button. In the example this is 597.
tutorial.query.standard.text.title: Textdescriptors
tutorial.query.standard.text.text1: Record can also contain descriptors with text fields that contain any input. A query is then made via a text search, e.g. in the DSMZbacdivedesc data set.
tutorial.query.standard.edit.title: Edit and delete criteria
tutorial.query.standard.edit.text1: The entire search query can be deleted by clicking on New in the toolbar. Individual criteria are deleted using the X icon next to the respective state. States can be edited by clicking on the pencil icon. The dialog window with the previously selected states opens.
tutorial.query.standard.load.title: Load and Save
tutorial.query.standard.load.text1: The search query can be saved in the file system of the PC/smartphone etc. via Save and reused later via Load. The query is saved in JSON format and contains the selected descriptors and states, the grouping and the data source used. Tip: A standard search can also be loaded in the extended search.
tutorial.query.extended.title: Extended Search
tutorial.query.extended.text1: In the extended search, different AND/OR groupings can be combined in one query.
tutorial.query.extended.text2: The figure shows the extended search. The combined and selected search query appears under Selected Query.
tutorial.query.extended.text3: You can create a new search query unter Create new query. For that you can select descriptors and states in - 1 Create a new single group - in the same way as in the standard query. With the button - Add to list - this new group is added to - 2 List of groups. There, all generated groups can be AND/OR combined with each other again. Those new groups again will be listed under - 2 List of groups -  and can be selected for a new combining. For executing one of those queries, you have to activate the checkbox of the selected group and click the Select - Button. The query then appears under - Selected query. By clicking the Search - Button the query starts.
tutorial.query.extended.text4: Next to - Results - the number of objects that meet the search criteria appears. The list of results is displayed in the - Results - tab/page.
tutorial.results.title: Guide - Results
tutorial.resultdetails.title: Results details
tutorial.results.text1: Switch to the tab Results (desktop version) or click on the Results button (mobile version) to display the list of results. If the item or object names are taxonomic names and the data set contains additional information regarding accepted names, the accepted names are displayed in the list. If the item names differ from the accepted names, the item name is also output in a second line.
tutorial.results.text2: You can navigate between the pages using the page navigation in the toolbar. The list of all result names can be saved using the Export button. The data is saved in JSON format.
tutorial.results.text3: Clicking on a result name opens a window with the detailed information. In the desktop version, the information is in tablular form, in the mobile version the information is presented in a list. All descriptors and states are listed under - Description. If there is additional information about a data record, this is listed under - Additional information. If a data set contains links to images, these are displayed under - Images.
tutorial.installation.title: Guide - Installation as App
tutorial.installation.text1: Depending on the hardware and browser, you can install DiversityNaviKey like an App. An example how to do this for an Android smartphone is shown below.
tutorial.installation.text2: First open the DNK page in a browser, e.g. the Samsung browser. An icon with a down arrow will appear next to the address bar. Click on it and confirm with the Install button.
tutorial.installation.text3: The DNK icon appears on the home screen. When calling the DiversityNaviKey as App the space on the smartphone is better used because the browser bar is missing. If the app has problems to start, e.g. after an update, you can always call the starting page of the app in the browser.
tutorial.installation.text4: Using windows you can install the DNK app by using the browser Chrome or Edge on your home screen in the same way as described above.
tutorial.gettingstarted.title: Guide - Getting started
tutorial.gettingstarted.text1: When the starting page of DNK is called up in a browser, a list of all available data sources is loaded. When first called up, or if no preferred data source has been saved, a dialog box for selecting the data source appears.
tutorial.gettingstarted.text2: The data source can be saved as preferred data source in the LocalStorage of the browser and is taken into account and loaded at the beginning of future DNK calls. You can change this at any time via the point Data within the menu point Settings.
tutorial.gettingstarted.text3: Some of the data sets include links to images. Loading of the images can also be activated or deactivated in the dialog box. The images are integrated via external links that are defined in the datasets. The app has no influence on the size of the images and the data volume. According to your internet provider there can be additional costs.
tutorial.gettingstarted.text4: The data is stored in the LocalStorage of the browser cache. If DNK is called again, the data set is loaded from the cache. Go to the point Data in the menu item Settings to change this setting.
tutorial.navigation.title: Guide - Navigation
tutorial.navigation.text1: The starting page of DNK displays the standard query tab. The menu with the points Home, Settings, Info, Imprint and Guide appears on the left. Next to the menu icon the currently selected data source name is displayed. In the example this is LIASLight. The selected search mode is on the far right. In the example this is Standard.
tutorial.navigation.text2: There are two tabs Query and Results in the desktop version of the app. In the tab Results the current number of results is displayed next to the word Results. Without a search request, the number is the total number of all items of the data set. In the mobile version of the app you can switch to the Results tab by clicking on the Results button or swiping to the right.
tutorial.navigation.text3: In the toolbar already saved querys can be loaded, new queries can be saved or the current query can be reset. The query appears below the toolbar.
